title: [$250] Mark as Paid is disabled for approved reports that do not require reimbursement, removing the ability to manually close non-reimbursable reports

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.11-53 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @Tmjarnesk1 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770242991792139) ## Action Performed: 1. Log into the Expensify web app (NewDot). 2. Navigate to Reports → Pay. 3. Open an Approved expense report that does not require reimbursement (e.g., card-only or company-paid expenses). 4. Click the Pay button on the report. ## Expected Result: The user should be able to select Mark as Paid  (like in Classic) to manually close the report, even when no reimbursement payout is required, in order to signal that the report has been fully reviewed, reconciled, and exported to the accounting system. ## Actual Result: The Mark as Paid option is disabled/greyed out unless the report has an active reimbursement payout. Admins cannot manually mark non-reimbursable reports as paid or closed. (Mark as paid button not displayed in NewDot staging and Reimburse button displayed in OldDot) ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6cdf249d-b894-4fd8-a327-16cbf835f64a [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.11-53
**Reproducible in staging?:** Y
**Reproducible in production?:** Y
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @sakluger 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770249649882279)

## Action Performed:

1. Disable Submissions (i.e. auto-submission) in a workspace in NewDot
2. In the same workspace, add a test company card feed with recent transactions, and assign one of the cards to a workspace member
3. Go to Reports > Statements and filter to the card feed you just added. Make sure the card feed has transactions included in your date range filters.
4. Go to Reports > Unapproved card and filter to the card feed you just added. Make sure the card feed has transactions included in your date range filters.

## Expected Result:
Unreported card expenses should appear under Reports > Statements and Reports > Unapproved card.
## Actual Result:
Unreported card expenses don't appear on these pages. You can further verify by adding some of the card expenses to a report in the workspace, then checking the Statements and Unapproved card pages again, and verifying that the expenses now show up.
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

Login to an account with copilot access 2. Switch to Copilot mode and select another user's account (via profile → Copilot access) 3. Navigate to a report with history/notes (approvals, edits, comments) ## Expected Result: Report history notes should load and display correctly for admins in Copilot mode, matching the behavior when viewing the same reports from their own admin account and matching Expensify Classic. ## Actual Result: In Copilot mode, the report history shows only a persistent loading skeleton (no content loads). Notes are visible when the admin views the same report from their own account, and visible in Expensify Classic. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

## Action Performed:

1. Log into the New Expensify web app as an admin
2. Go to a workspace chat 
3. Create a new expense (scan expense with receipt)
4. Attempt to Submit the expense 

## Expected Result:
The expense is successfully created and submitted to the target report or recipient without any errors.
## Actual Result:
An error message appears: “Unexpected error submitting this expense. Please try again later.” Unexpected error creating this chat. Please try again later.”

Unknown

title: [$250] Default share sheet option to `Submit` vs `Share` for all members

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
We're currently defaulting the mobile share sheet to `Share` vs `Submit` for some reason – even though our mainline case is `Submit`. As a result, let's fix that and make sure that the initial option is always `Submit`, especially since you can submit to yourself if you aren't a member of a paid workspace.

title: [$250] Add `Range` UI filter for all date-type filters

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
We're seeing that customers are confused how to add date ranges using the UI search filters. This is possible via the existing `Before` and `After` filters, though on Classic the UX is a bit more clear since you can see the both ranges visually at the same time. Based on discussion in Slack, let's add a `Range` option within the existing date filters, as this makes filtering on date ranges more obvious. The changes are: - Add a `Range` option to all date based filters - `Range` will appear as the bottom-most option - The date filters where this applies are `Date`, `Approved`, `Paid`, `Submitted`, `Withdrawn`, `Posted`, `Exported` (let me know if I missed any). - A user is required to select at least two dates. If they select one, we'll show a standard form error. **Mobile examples** **Desktop examples**

title: Add sections within the `Group by` filters

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
I was chatting with a customer, who found the `Group by` filter options quite overwhelming. Let's make a small change and add little sections to make the options easier to scan. Changes: - Add sections for `Member`, `Expense details`, `Date`, `Bank reconciliation` (in that order) - The options within each section are: - `Member` - `From` - `Expense details` - `Card`, `Merchant`, `Category`, `Tag`, - `Date` - `Week`, `Month`, `Quarter`, `Year` - `Bank reconciliation` - `Withdrawal ID`
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @shubham1206agra

title: [$250] Change empty states

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Previously we've had this skeleton + card for empty states: This worked well for a while, but we'd now like to replace them with something simpler and more obvious to encourage users to get started quicker. --- This is what we have in mind: Hopefully this requires tweaking the empty state component we already have as it's mostly: - Remove skeleton in the background - Remove card container - Remove background container with solid color - Change button from full-width to auto and from large to regular The places I can think of empty states: - Reports page and all the items in the left hand navigation - Workspace tab - Workspaces -> Workspace -> Categories - Workspaces -> Workspace -> Tags - Workspaces -> Workspace -> Members (or I guess this is never empty so maybe it doesn't have one) - Workspaces -> Workspace -> Distance rates - Workspaces -> Workspace -> Per diem - Workspaces -> Workspace -> Taxes - Account -> Expense rules - Any others? cc @Expensify/design @JmillsExpensify
